intro: Cardaminopsis sinuata, commonly known as the slender buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features delicate, trifoliate leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
